Interactive Visualization Suite - Bidirectional highlighting across all views
description:
Multi-PR epic implementing:
1. Bidirectional highlighting (click node → select code, click code → highlight node)
2. Zoom/focus interactions for Rings visualization
3. New Radial Tidy Tree visualization with D3
4. Shared state management and visual consistency across all views

Spans 3 PRs with atomic, testable increments.

title: Rename 'Tree' visualization to 'Nodes' throughout codebase
description:
Update all references from 'Tree' to 'Nodes' for clarity:
- SegmentedControl options
- vizMode state type
- Variable names and comments
Rationale: We're showing individual AST nodes, not a tree diagram structure.

title: Create RadialTreeVisualization component with D3 tree layout
description:
New visualization using Reingold-Tilford algorithm:
1. Use d3.tree().size([2*Math.PI, radius])
2. Convert polar (angle, radius) to cartesian coordinates
3. Render nodes as circles, links as curved paths
4. Use d3.linkRadial() for path generation
5. Basic structure, no highlighting yet

Reference: https://observablehq.com/@d3/radial-tree/2

title: Implement smart label positioning and rotation in radial tree
description:
Readable labels in radial layout:
1. Primary rotation: (angle * 180/π - 90) positions radially
2. Secondary rotation: flip text 180° on right hemisphere (avoid upside-down)
3. Text anchor: 'start' on left, 'end' on right
4. Position outside circles
5. Font: var(--font-mono), naturalist colors

Reference: Observable radial tree example

title: Integrate selectedNode highlighting in radial tree
description:
Add bidirectional highlighting to radial view:
1. Receive selectedNode prop from App
2. Selected node: --vermillion fill, white text
3. Ancestor path: highlight links from root to selected (vermillion stroke)
4. Normal nodes: --paper-weathered fill, --ink-light stroke
5. Click node → onNodeClick(d.data.node) → updates App state

Reference: Observable collapsible tree highlighting

title: Add D3 zoom and pan behavior to radial tree
description:
Navigation for large trees:
1. Implement d3.zoom() behavior
2. Mouse wheel → zoom in/out
3. Click-drag → pan around tree
4. Click node → smooth transition to center it (250ms)
5. Constrain zoom bounds (min/max scale)

Enables exploration of deep AST structures

title: Add 'Radial' option to visualization toggle in App
description:
Expand visualization modes:
1. Update SegmentedControl to support 3 options: 'Nodes' / 'Rings' / 'Radial'
2. Update vizMode state type: 'nodes' | 'rings' | 'radial'
3. Add RadialTreeVisualization to App import and render logic
4. Pass selectedNode prop consistently to all three views
5. Test toggle switching between all three modes

title: Test bidirectional highlighting with edge cases
description:
Verify highlighting works correctly:
- Empty selections in code
- Click whitespace/comments (no AST node)
- Very deep nesting (performance)
- Rapid clicking between nodes
- Switching between visualization modes while highlighted
- Overlapping/nested nodes with same position

Document any edge cases discovered

title: Performance optimization for highlighting with large ASTs
description:
If edge case testing reveals performance issues:
- Memoize AST traversal results
- Debounce cursor position updates
- Virtual scrolling for very deep trees
- Lazy rendering for off-screen nodes

Only implement if testing shows it's needed

title: Add selectedNode state to App.tsx for shared highlighting
description:
Create shared state for cross-component highlighting:
- Add useState<ts.Node | null>(null)
- Pass to CodeEditor, ASTTree, RingsVisualization as prop
- Foundation for bidirectional highlighting in all views

title: Implement Node → Code highlighting in CodeEditor
description:
When user clicks AST node:
1. Receive selectedNode prop from App
2. Extract node.pos and node.end (character positions)
3. Use CodeMirror EditorView.dispatch() to set selection
4. Scroll selected text into view with scrollIntoView: true

Technical: CodeMirror selection API, state effects

title: Implement Code → Node highlighting traversal algorithm
description:
When user clicks/moves cursor in code:
1. Listen to CodeMirror selection changes
2. Get cursor position (character offset)
3. Traverse AST to find deepest node containing position
4. Algorithm: recursive depth-first search checking node.pos <= cursor <= node.end
5. Call setSelectedNode(foundNode)

Technical: ts.forEachChild, position checking

title: Wire up click handlers in ASTTree/ASTNode for highlighting
description:
Connect nodes view to highlighting system:
1. Pass onNodeClick prop through ASTTree → TreeNode → ASTNode
2. On click: call onNodeClick(node) → updates App selectedNode state
3. Verify isHighlighted prop triggers vermillion styling
4. Test: click node → code highlights, click code → node highlights

title: Add focusedNode state to RingsVisualization for zoom
description:
Enable zoom capability:
1. Add useState<ts.Node | null> for focused subtree
2. When null: show full tree (current behavior)
3. When set: re-run D3 pack layout with focusedNode as root
4. Foundation for click-to-zoom interaction

title: Implement click-to-zoom with D3 transitions in Rings view
description:
Zoom interaction:
1. On circle click: setFocusedNode(d.data.node) AND setSelectedNode (dual update)
2. Re-run D3 pack layout with new root
3. D3 transition animation (250ms, match --duration-quick)
4. Maintains hover highlight behavior (color change on hover)

Result: Click ring → zoom + code highlight

title: Implement smart label display for zoomed rings (type + literal values)
description:
Label strategy when zoomed:
- Top level: Show node type name (e.g., 'BinaryExpression')
- If literal with value: Display value in circle center
  - StringLiteral → "text"
  - NumericLiteral → number
  - BooleanLiteral → true/false

Fonts: var(--font-mono), naturalist styling

title: Add breadcrumb navigation to Rings visualization
description:
Breadcrumb UI at top of container:
1. Show path: Root → ... → Current Focus
2. Each segment clickable → zoom out to that level
3. 'Reset' button → return to full tree (setFocusedNode(null))
4. Styling: naturalist theme, --font-mono, paper-elevated background

Helps users understand context and navigate back
